article:
LIn 1954 the London firm of Cassell published The Scourge of the Swastika: A Short History of Nazi War Crimes by Lord Russell Elie Cohen's Human Behaviour in the Concentration Camp, originally published in Dutch and then in English translation Ph.D. dissertation from the University of Utrecht... Het Duitse Concentratiekamp; een Medishe en Psychologische Studie was published in 1952 ... by the Amsterdam house of H.J. Paris. When translated by M.H. Braaksma for publication first in 1953 by W.W.Norton of New York, and then in 1954 by Jonathan Cape of London Nyiszli's article of 1951 in Les Temps Modernes Nyiszli's longer Auschwitz: A Doctor's Eyewitness Account... introduction by Bruno Bettelheim A Dame Is Snatched (by Ricky Commorde) Techniques of Nude Photograph (by Philip Gotlop... Samuel Beckett's Watt "Snozzle" Davis (editor of An Encyclopedia of Fun and Intimate Burlesk) Scourge of the Swastika 1953 the Irish dramatist Denis Johnston published a curious autobiography entitled Nine Rivers From Jordan Johnston's... best-known play, The Old Lady Says "No" (1929) Dr. J. C. McQuaid... Fr. Joseph Deery ... it is reasonable to assume that any exchange between them took place orally. Michael Adams, Censorship: The Irish Experience (Dublin: Scepter Books, 1968). Adams's ... "Notes on Controversies 1946-1966" (249-253) Kevin Rockett, Irish Film Censorship (Dublin: Four Courts Press, 2004) Donal O Drisceoil, Censorship in Ireland 1939-1945: Neutrality, Politics and Society (Cork: Cork University Press, 1996)
Discipline in the Home and School (1959). Deery published Saint Louis-Marie de Montfort anonymously in 1952 with the Catholic Truth Society. 1958 Brown and Nolan issued [Deery's] more substantial book, Our Lady of Lourdes, again anonymously. James Kelly, "The Operation of the Censorship of Publications Board: The Notebooks of C. J. O'Reilly 1951-1955," Analecta Hibernica no. 38 (2004): 223-369.
Ibid., 227-228. Elie A. Cohen, Human Behaviour in the Concentration Camp, rev. ed. (London: Free Association Books, 1988), 141. A. L. Vischer, Barbed Wire Disease: A Psychological Study of the Prisoner of War (London: Bale and Danielsson, 1919). Cohen, Concentration Camp, 140. E. Federn, "Terror as a System," Psychiatric Quarterly Supplement 22, part I (1948): 52-86. Jorge Semprun, Literature or Life, trans. Linda Coverdale (New York: Penguin, 1998), 164. Eli Aron Cohen, hearing of witness, November 20, 1952, HHStAW, Section 460, No. 1424 (Wollheim v. I. G. Farben), 1:132-133. Miklos Nyiszli, Dr. Mengele boncoloorvosa voltam az Auschwitz-I krematoriumban (Debrecen: Varosi Ny., 1946). Cohen wrote a short autobiography in Dutch, De Afgrond, een Egodocument (Amsterdam: Paris-Manteau, 1972) [Cohen] translated into English by James Brockway as The Abyss: A Confession (New York: Norton, 1973). T. W. Adorno, Minima Moralia: Reflections from Damaged Life, trans. Edmund Jeffcott (London: Verso, 1974), 49.
